meanings.definition: A secondary line or division within a larger group or system.
meanings.sent1: The book had sublines at the bottom of each page for additional information.
meanings.sent2: The sublines on the map helped us navigate through the city more easily.
meanings.sent3: The sublines in the painting added a touch of color to the overall design.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like sublines branching off from the main idea.
meanings.sent5: The sublines on the document were crucial for understanding the complex data.

meanings.definition: To create or designate a subline within a larger structure.
meanings.sent1: She decided to sublines the text to make it easier to read.
meanings.sent2: The architect will sublines the building plans for better organization.
meanings.sent3: He likes to sublines his notes with different colors for fun.

meanings.sent5: The teacher will sublines the assignment to highlight the key points.

meanings.definition: To emphasize or highlight a specific aspect or detail within a larger context.
meanings.sent1: The speaker will sublines the importance of teamwork in his presentation.
